2IBgFnlOSakJQjSYCNF7bQ.text: If you're looking for the fish and chip thing, pretty much anywhere in this area will taste and cost similar, so you might as well go for the ambiance.  This place is right across the street from Big Ben, making it Uber Convenient for the quick tourist meal.  Diners seemed all touristy but locals standing at the bar.  It was crowded and we had to wait with a beeper it's ode but it was only 5-10 minutes.  Yes, many on tap are room temp., which is normal here so no loss of stars for that.

_LkxAwmTHDXu1N9vZ3bD3Q.text: This pub has a perfect location, just across from Westminster Palace.  It has a great story of the place that members of Parliament would go to drink between votes.  There is a bell there rung to let the drinkers know when it was time to go back to vote.  It is a small building, with a pub area downstairs and small dining room (not many tables, keep this in mind) in a lofted area up the stairs.  We went with the fish and chips but also with a combo with the fried prawns.  The fried prawns are definitely great to get here.  Surprisingly for the location, not a bad bill at the end.

JGdsdHkQk-JJ39dGsC2o1g.text: Came across this place while visiting big ben. The ales here were great as was the fish and chips. My wife had a chicken pie and that too was delicious. They were kind enough to let me try some samples of beer before I made my choice thanks guys. Service was friendly and attentive. Can't wait to come back to london and visit this establishment again.

uo2irpW9rw7FfWNi6eGZfg.text: The food was solid, and the beer was good, but I've had better fish and chips at a similarly priced venue. The chips were good, and the scampi was actually excellent. It also needs to be said that the service was quite good and overall friendly. But overall, I just got the impression that this establishment has figured out it has prime real estate and just isn't trying that hard to be at all exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. View of the nice windows and the bar.

dePo8OS4uoDUmHkJc8RiKw.text: It's too bad this place isn't better, because it certainly has many gifts.First off the location is amazing, with views of Parliament out the windows and just outside. It's surprisingly calm considering it's in tourist central. I've never found it too overwhelmed with out-of-towners. Always a bit of space available to tip a pint.The interior is cozily appointed: nice fixtures, plush rugs, dark wood. The only thing - and this kills me because I'm all for saving the environment - is the energy efficient bulbs make this place feel sterile and cold, like a hospital operating theater or interview room at police headquarters. Maybe they could invest in some lampshades?The staff was all right. Neither great nor bad. The selection of beer is the same. If you need a pint, you could do worse getting one here, but you'll hardly find some new and unexpected craft beer here.

FGDWO1lZRf7EZ587L3W_AQ.text: Horrible food service upstairs!! Our female server (calling her a waitress would be insulting to waitresses) was rude, no personality and is in the wrong profession. Why a place with such a great location would allow this person to work there is a shame. It was my wife and my final dinner in London after a wonderful 3 night stay. The convenience from our Westminster Bridge hotel was hard to ignore for this final British experience from Boston. This youngish, non-British female server (wish I had her name) took our order without a hint of a smile and gave only my wife her drink order - I order the same - but she delivered only one! Then reminding her of my order she put it in front of me with no apology whatsoever. She later collect the empty bottle of my wife with a reach across her face and again no apology! The different person who collect our tab at least asked how things were with a smile - Manager please fire the young female server working the evening of Weds April 12Go here for a beer but this place does not deserve customers wanting a meal

6AhkJUHhgQpoY2FHZsmb6A.text: Good spot for ducking into after the Churchill war rooms. Salad was almost without taste - thank goodness for the copious amount of bacon. Everyone else loved their meal.

EGFnptDAS_zCPFa0ei6IYA.text: Not many options, with sub par service. I had the full English breakfast with a flat white. So, maybe its a local thing, but I expected to be served. You have to place your order at the bar and then sit down, then they will bring your food to you. Bacon appeared to be half cooked. The beans were good and the sausage was very tasty, but the rest was just mediocre.

8R1k5eztAsRqID4pcWGEDA.text: Stumbled onto this spot during my sightseeing travels in London this fall. Stopped by Big Ben and Parliment and went in for lunch. It is a cozy, old style pub with plenty of ales flowing. Had my first English pub ale, a light Badger pint to start. (Can't really get used to luke warm beer of any kind, but it was good) Ordered the Fish and chips with peas. It was the best i have ever had back home in the US. The fish was tasty and flaky. the batter was crispy. Great flavor. Did not go wrong with this choice. Definitely go after the lunch rush and before the end of the work day. this place fills up fast and you will have to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. The most delicious Fish & Chips i have EVER had.
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Nice mixture of people. Business, tourists and everyday people relaxing and enjoying a brew.
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. My First Official English Ale in an authentic English Pub! Can't get any better than that!

KWo6Dc00UmK4ds-VdDwVGQ.text: My wife and I had dinner here our first night in London. It's across the street from Saint Stephen's tower (what everybody calls Big Ben which is actually the name of the bell inside the tower). After seeing this on many top 10 lists we decided to give it a try.I ordered the traditional fish and chips and my wife had the steak and ale pie. The crust on my fish was so light and crispy and the fish inside it was really moist and flavorful. My wife's dish also had a fantastic crust (pastry crust) and the filling was really savory. Washed down with a good pint of beer this was a great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

IDGDmUTC2qH6KO0rVoxW-w.text: Got a gentle ribbing from the bartender for ordering a half. Later I got another half. The badger beers here were so bland I couldn't commit to a while pint of any of them. Why are their pub beers so lame when their bottles beers are so very tasty?We enjoyed some food here....that at least tastes a bit more interesting than the beer!We had quite a blue conversation and I suspect the people around us were not disappointing when we left.

wVlXa31xmbdCb3RBPxGk3w.text: Food is mediocre. Beer is mediocre. Service is horrendous. The lady who seats you was incredibly rude to not only us but to tables around us, so rude in fact, that they left when she commented meanly about how they took a table up and we're just drinking. Not even worth it.

fj4EidqbteCwxksBcEBDlg.text: My friends and I were sightseeing and we wanted to try the fish and chips in London. So we settled on this place and loved it! We each had a beer and had an amazing lunch!

jnfO3CjDIEBE3YHW3PDJvQ.text: Great fish and chips, decent selection of beers, decent service, good value.

F_PAvdjLedW2dFkd8u4d8A.text: Hate to do this, but easily the worst fish and chips I have ever ordered.  Both my wife and I ordered this and did not eat the fish.  Bones through the fish combined with a soft and greasy fish made this terrible.  When the manager asked us how the meal was, we said the fish was not satisfactory.  His response was astonishing....."we rely on our suppliers and can't control the quality from our suppliers."  He did not offer a break on the bill either.....just apologies.The Guinness was good, I must say that.

QA8XFaQIWoj2ZMadcnNEzA.text: Did you know the word pub comes from public space.  This is what these bars were considered by many.   In this case, its a wonderful small public space with great beer and great fish and chips.

Dsmsa24EyMDNtxlmNuVKqw.text: This place was jam packed.  Probably due to the thunderstorm rolling through.  Burger was good.  Fish and chips weren't anything special. Skin was still on the fish under the batter. Strange.  Definitely greasy. I've had better fish and chips elsewhere.

-yEcXWRsIUL38MoJr5SkXg.text: Stopped in for late breakfast/early lunch on our way to the Abbey and Big Ben.  Was lucky and found a table fairly quick.  You order at the bar.  We got the fish n chips and the appetizer size of the meat pie.  The appetizer portion of the meat pie could be a meal, and for 4.75GBP it was a bargain. It was tasty.  The fish n chips were good too.  Nice place.  Wouldn't go out of my way to get here, but since it's in such a convenient location (i.e. close to a lot of sights), I would recommend it.

ZyWwKQYtpY36wPqjGv6ggQ.text: Very nice athmosphere. So close to the parliament a pub everyone can enter. Tables are reserved, but when asking one they give you a table. Good selection of beers in a neighbourhood where there a not to many. Certainly will back here for there selection of beers.

U3O0IW-3oR14IqYIY6utqQ.text: Good food for a better price than you'll find in other parts of town near other attractions.We ate up stairs in a quaint cramped little room with green seating.  The tables use little green stools as chairs.The girls who took our order and seated us were very nice and attentive .I ordered the seasonal ale which was o.k., and the fish n chips. They were cheap with the chips and only gave me but one piece of fish.  It was good, but again, not great.My son had an apple drink with gas that was good. He also had the Classic hamburger which was disappointing.  They didn't even ask him how he wanted it cooked.  All burgers are cooked well done there.My daughter had an apple juice that was great. She also ordered the salmon and prawn pie, which she enjoyed.My niece had a Guinness which she enjoyed a lot and the bangers and mash.  She reported that her plate was tasty and satisfying.All the plates came with peas that tasted like wax.  Why the English don't steam their veggies is a mystery.My wife had a Coke and a bowl of chicken curry that came with rice and bread.  It was fantastic.I ended up paying about $30 per person which for London was cheap.We all left happily satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. This is the view of the Elizabeth Tower (Big Ben) while standing in the door of the tavern waiting to be sat.

AK3kFi1HHfQjRp4ajMsiWA.text: Good pub at a great location.  Bartenders are friendly and willing to help you find a beer you'll like.  We even had one bartender confiscate one of our beers a few gulps in because it looked too cloudy to him.  He promptly replaced it with a fresh full pint!My wife and I returned a second time a couple days later from Waterloo.  This time we sat upstairs for lunch.  Service was friendly up there albeit a little slow.  Fish and chips were good but the fish pie was excellent.

Ft5_G90nGKfTrJU5Pka59g.text: Food was good, seating is not comfortable though. View of BIG BEN is nice!

T8pkj9mmwqfI2Zgj43Ao3g.text: I stopped in for lunch at the recommendation of a local nearby. The decor is fun and the servers are friendly when you can track them down. My meal however was bland and expensive, but I had low expectations. I'd only stop in again for a drink but know they won't allow table and a seat unless you're eating. Lots of tourists!

-wTZy_kKucC1hxAgf7OS-A.text: Overpriced drinks but you can't beat the view - right across the street from Big Ben and Westminster Abbey. Pub seating downstairs and outside patio. Dining room seating upstairs.

vkCO5jT0IVO7Ews2J4Dl6w.text: We came here as we could not leave without having fish and chips in London, but go figure, most places weren't open around 11 AM on a Sunday. This was the only place we could find nearby that was open, but seating is quite limited. We were lucky to get a table as people were just leaving.You order at the bar, and we ordered fish and chips with extra fries (pass on the peas) and a traditional cornish pastry. Both were super tasty, although the fish was a bit oily of course. I like how they have various Heinz condiments on the table ranging from tartar, english mustard, etc.Prices are very reasonable, and we had a good meal that didn't leave us distgustingly full.

mGUgX2hrohtfRBRea67_gA.text: This pub is literally across the street from Big Ben/Parliament and Westminster Abby, but is kind of hidden which explains the few reviews.  There's only a single door that faces the main street - everything else is happening out of sight.Theres a big, front bar.  Small, back bar.  And a second floor for eating.  Built in the 1770's,  it has old school charm but is also adorned with photos and press clippings from the last 100 years of govt... Llyod George & Winston to Maggie to Blair and Gordon.    Most surprising to me was the prices were normal, despite it being in the epicenter of tourists and politics.  Drinks were a few quid and they were offering Sunday roast for under 10 (didn't eat).  Super friendly staff.  This could easily pass for a local pub if it weren't for the fact that the governing of the British Empire happens across the street (and possibly in this pub between votes).

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

vN60uiM3jK19Ar55zHp3Rw.text: We stopped in on our own pub crawl while visiting from the US just to grab some starters and a beer real quick and the starters were awesome. The service was good, beer was great, and the place itself was pretty cool

ePAmm2IW-GPq_s6YVtDJCQ.text: Extremely cramped, but service and food were good.  The sausage and mash came with a really hearty gravy with sauteed onions, and the mashed potatoes tasted homemade---nice and buttery.  The fish and chips were average.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. My first taste of sticky toffee pudding...  That's when I decided that I REALLY like England! So yummy!
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. fish n chips
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. sausage and mash with rich yummy gravy

q96BhkUUbb20vDhaMQ3ESQ.text: Pretty convenient as it's near the city center, within walking distance to Big Ben, the Parliament, and Westminster Abbey.They also have free wi-fi too. The bar menu seems to be aligned with the other bars in London. I guess they pretty much serve the same thing. Prices are consistent too.They have a decent amount of beers on tap. Some cold and some at room temperature. So if you're not used to room temperature beer, you better ask first.

2zajN_VxhnkStffM8JAD6A.text: This was our first restaurant stop in London for fish and chips. We loved the style of the restaurant and the old fixtures. Very quaint and was my vision of what a London pub was like. Cramped quarters but I really liked it. Fish and chips was great. I parred it with a beer. Very good. Food came out quick. Staff very nice!

Fpx1AY7J2dihYAOK_ageAQ.text: We were there at 5pm on a workday and it was fun watching the crowd.  Reminded me of happy hour on Capital Hill in Wash DC.   Excellent fish and chips, and many beers, including Amstel light, on draft.

FDesG6Y1T1Y_f99cxqNrkg.text: If the view and location wasn't so cool it probably would have been a 3 star for me.  Good beer, cider and wine selection.  Did not eat but fish n chips looked good from afar.  I cool place to people watch and feel like your part of parliament.  Chances are you'll see some MPs doing the government's business.

k4bp7QKZa8WOJQXaNnvtbw.text: Good variety of alcohol and beer, cool vibe but the food is not that good. Definitely would go again for a drink

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

xtdS_Kt8_wp0Pny3YoOTDw.text: I'll make this short and sweet.1) Packed & touristy... go figure, it's right next to Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament.2) Ordinary pub food. The burger may possibly be the best thing to order.3) Great view of Big Ben from downstairs at the bar.My point: Don't eat here. Just have a drink at the bar downstairs, admire Big Ben from behind the glass, and be on your way.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

gmjoSaF5lQoR3RS01DWtoA.text: I love this bar!  Yes, it's by the touristy area but isn't it nice to have a decent selection when you're in the area?  They make this amazing hot chocolate with liquor in it, it'll warm you up.  The place is cozy and definitely crowded but squeeze in and embrace it.  The staff is great!  As for the food, it's decent but not the best that London has to offer at all.  I always stop by for a drink when in London, good stuff!

lt50e-cd-7CzCnBeGPkRYw.text: I enjoyed visiting this place.  I would highly suggest whoever is touring.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone.

wk0ljuJaaHAdQ1MihqVDOQ.text: The beers were flat and the bartender acknowledged it but would not consider replacing them with good beers. We were going to eat but we left instead. And the bartender poured us 4 Guinness pints when we asked for one.  None too smart when there were 5 of us and the other 4 already had their beers.

9N9S8imvTX5uuc4SYlcfsg.text: Great bar with good food in London.  Lots of different beers and such.  Service is really quick.I ordered the fish and chips and it was really good.  The fish was crispy outside and really moist inside without the trace of oil.   Definitely a place to try near the square.

PFy0ORZEF4dv4DsR6wLKVQ.text: stopped in here for a quick and cheap cornish pasty with a friend and it was pretty good but at the same time nothing that special.  for a spot right across from the houses of parliament though the prices were good and the decor not too touristy.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. has to be tried!

V-TqV5RoXxZ03A03Rnx3kQ.text: We were here three times during our one week trip to London. You will be seated on a very very small table, sometimes the table is for two, the other day we got the same table, but we were four people. My neighbour said: it's cozy here. That's true and it's true that you might have to wait for about 10 to 20 minutes for a table, but you can wait at the bar having a wonderful ale and you get a buzzer indicating when your table is ready. I really enjoyed the ales they have, especially the light "Hopeful Hop".The fish and chips here are great and also the pies. We have been here three times during our week in London, just because we liked it so much.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Sauces for fish&chips
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

vjBld7HhcJX8Gs2wX33ZSg.text: Coziest little pub in the heart of Westminster. Great place to stop in for some local grub (fish, chips, and peas for me!) and beer! Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish, chips, and peas at St Stephen's in Westminster, London.

nwfQhfaKmB09vHXHF7JVAQ.text: I wasnt fond of this. Service was curt and not friendly. I felt rushed and the food was just "ok." I expected more and I absolutely loathe being told "we don't have that anymore" about an item that's still on the menu.

pkv-jP158cue8KbPp2KfQg.text: Nice bar right across from Westminster Abbey and Big Ben. It's got British vibes filled with tourists. Good food. Good selection of beer. Walking distance to Thames River.

_nv_qgnQMUK3pZhQOjhIUw.text: Visited this pub while we were visiting London. Great fish and chips and nice beer selections. Lots of other menu choices.The wait can be a bit long depending on the time of day. We visited around 2pm and had a 20 minute wait. There is a full bar downstairs and a dining room in the second floor. Service was prompt and very friendly.

IWQsQ9ticsav5Xju07BKXw.text: Tiny tables, high prices and mediocre food. My husband found a hair in his (it was baked into the cheese so it was not mine or his) and when he brought it to the attention of the staff they were nonplussed. He had to request a replacement and the waitress seemed put out by the request. No apology was offered, and certainly no discount! I know standards can be different in Europe, but this was unacceptable.

CUAH5sO38ezg-d_lDeo3Tw.text: There seems to be a bit of a food island around the House of Commons.   Not much selection when you need to eat right away.  Came here after going to Westminster Abby.   We were able to get a table pretty quickly.   You place your order at the bar, the food came out quickly.   I have as able to check off my London Steak Pie on my food to eat list.  It was fantastic.  Although I have no point of reference.  Service was good.  Food was great.  I would come back.

wnLd0Ya7tgcxLTbMuvYALw.text: I came here with my classmates, a crew of 6, and it was home to my first real international mealtime experience. Granted, I've been to a pub once or twice before this, but this was the first full restaurant meal and drink I've been to.   It is fantastic, I had of course, fish and chips-it was a large portion and truly hot.They were quite busy when we arrived, so we were able to get some drinks from the bar while waiting with a pager that let us know when a table was ready. As a result, we got to sit on the top balcony and at the table that let us look over to the floor below and the windows outside, it was an amazing view.The downside really was how crowded it is-granted I know the reason is due to it's location being at a tourist' hotspot, but I didn't care for the crowd. Regardless, the servers were friendly and the atmosphere was pleasant. I would certainly go again if I could.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. For the first time. Fish and chips. My first enlist meal in London

G6zN06GEHQLDl-aoynVyTA.text: A quick trip, a quick stop - didn't do any research just walked in, we weren't disappointed. Service was prompt & friendly - crowd was local, added to flair of the place - food - good

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Quaint, had a pint & fish +chips- loved that is more of a local crowd-

AlkHqBoxmnwVlCAa_XBCRA.text: I have visited it twice and wasn't blown away. It's definitely conveniently situated near Big Ben and it means that it's very crowded. The amount of people there was huge, we didn't wait very long for food but if you don't like crowds you should steer clear of this place. Food was ok, nothing special but they definitely have nice range of beers there which was a plus.

rfYV3CDTg4TTqmNUze6yFg.text: After a debate at the House of Lords, we were looking for a coffee shop to sit down and carry on the discussion. But neither coffee shop in the vicinity (Nero & Treats) has seating space, which was why we finally ended up in a pub.It was fairly comfortable and drinks were standard pricing. (We didn't try any food). Cosy interiors, but the biting cold and rain outside didn't help.Downstairs to the loo, which seems to have a lot of walk ins just to use it, so its not the cleanest.Staff at the bar who served us our drinks, were quick and efficient.

s_VeDWLnoH-JYSBKWOze9w.text: Good atmosphere and service but only average food. Went around 5pm on a Thursday and the bar was crowded but upstairs Dining wasn't too bad.

7CXR0hikvjEEogIIEmqicQ.text: We came here to get the fish n chips. It was pretty bland and not what we wanted at all. We got a chicken pot pie thing as well with it which wasn't great either. The service was ok as well. If you are starving and wandering around the parliament area, then come here but otherwise it's not worth it.

tHGVPwqzxlaHdinQc78KNg.text: Was sure this was going to be a tourist trap but was pleasantly surprised that the food, drinks and patrons were all legit.  We had prawn appetizers and some fish and chips (along with a Guinness)  Prices were good, service was fine and we had some great conversations with the locals.  We sat in the bar area which is semi-self serve but we did not have to wait long for a table.

7b1qmdNsdPCxPySfcGJGaA.text: I heard that the restaurants around the touristy places were the worst... but St. Stephen's Tavern was pretty damn good. My cousin got the basic tourist dish (fish and chips), my dad got the pasta chicken pesto dish (really good!) and I... I got the STEAK PIE.... and it was friggin' delicious. The staff was friendly. The place is small (we sat upstairs). But overall, we had a great time there. It was my dad's first time in London, and he is a very picky person, but he loved St. Stephen's Tavern (especially the Peroni beers!) I would come here again!

SwfgKZ7QYW689yEnsyMIKQ.text: Long wait, bad food. Avoid this place. The food is overpriced and the service is terrible.  We ran in to get out of the rain and wouldn't come back. Ok for an expensive beer I guess

cjfdiyywxtrWZ2azILwmKw.text: We were exhausted walking around and just needed a place to get a good and fair prices meal! This was the perfect place right across from Big Ben. The food was amazing and definitely recommend the Meat Pie dish, very hearty and filling!

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Meat pies

rY4be1RiMv63oFs1u0-5OQ.text: We stopped in for some lunch after a long day of touring. They were very busy. We were told it would be about a 10 minute wait. There was no place to sit and wait so I sat on the stairs. The host got very snotty with me and said there would be people going up and down the stair. I told him I would move if need be. Soon after that we got our table. Our table was very small for three people. Very uncomfortable. I asked for an ice tea, they do not have ice tea. I the saw lemon aid on the menu, I ordered it. Turns out it was 7-up. I asked for the special of the day....they were out. I also asked if we could move to a bigger table ( there was one right next to us) was told no we could not. She did finally let us more. There customer service is poor at best. The food was just ok. I had a chicken curry bowl. It was mostly rice, a little chicken and even less curry. We are in London for 2 more days and I will not be going back here.

efss_AccnueYwE3ZhoHLmg.text: Try the Old Mount Cider. I am a beer person, but I always grab cider when I am here. When I am showing my mates around Westminster, this is the spot we end up at. The food is okay, smallish fish n chips, and not a fan of their chili nachos. Good for relaxing after sight seeing. Seating only for those getting food.

vnRe-Ii4MSGt7M2FcPj9Fw.text: A very busy location because of Big Ben & Westminster Abbey. The quarters are a bit cramped on the second floor where we ate, but cozy, with a very traditional vibe. The wait staff were congenial for the most part, but inattentive. The food was average, the fish & chips was quite greasy and mostly batter, but not unenjoyable. I was confused by the menu offering black coffee but consequently being told it was an americano.Unsurprisingly, it was a bit of a tourist trap, and quite expensive. Between the 4 of us it was roughly £65.

WzfExPEVB-xxe8NKhLUbMw.text: Hey they do not take American Express. Be forewarned. Try the Fish and Chips Platter with shrimp and mashed peas.

fxjWhuwbBaOHF8sV9Q1QuA.text: See end for why I gave it 4 stars: loved this place and will go back again. We got sausage and mash, fish and chips, and mini pies. Finished with sticky chocolate pudding and cherry pie. All delicious!! ONLY down-fall was the ladies' toilets. Smelled SO BAD, it was like the boys room. If they clean that up, it would be 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

0wU3bYNOPi3Y1zBhRGMckw.text: Located right across the street from the famous Big Ben we found this old school British Pub and decided to give it a try. We wanted to try authentic fish and chips and our taxi driver recommended this place for the food and the location. We were seated in the second floor of the restaurant since the first floor consist more of the bar rather then tables. I ordered a pint of the house lager and then we all ordered the fish and chips without the green peas.We waited a while for the food to arrive, but the waiter was really cool and he started a really interesting conversation on all the cool things to do in London. When the plate finally arrived and it was large and the fish was brown and very crispy while the chips or how we American say french fries were also nice and crispy. Regarding the fish I got to be honest the taste was really bland I didn't really cared for the mayonnaise type of sauce on the side. For dessert we decided to order the chocolate pudding which was amazing, it gave us a sweet ending to our meal. The pudding in London is more like a moist pound cake with hot fudge pour on top rather than the pudding found in the states. We really did enjoy the exterior of the pub I felt that I was going to bump into Sherlock Holmes himself!

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. The complete pub experience!!!
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. The best part the Chocolate pudding!!!
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. The Fish and Chips!!!

aJWGV9ggzDJi5RtTRBDZUw.text: After trying to capture the perfect shot of that grand ol' clock tower at night, my fingers were practically frozen on Westminster Bridge. I somehow slowly managed to click my yelp app, and the closest restaurant that really stood out to me was St Stephen's Tavern.Just a block away from the bridge, this pub was easy to find, bustling with many patrons as was seen through the windows. My instant worry was that there wouldn't be space for us to actually sit down and eat. However, to my surprise, the upstairs tables had a few open spots left, and we were promptly given one.First impression: Blimey! Such small seats and tables!Oh well, I was already warming up to the place as my fingers slowly thawed.Although I saw on reviews that the place is visited by locals and tourists alike, it seemed like we were the only tourists there on that night. Maybe it was the way the waiters, with their particularly prosaic expressions, seemed to treat us with a slight annoyance.I ordered the fish and chips because why not just fully embrace that tourist life. Although I didn't have the opportunity to taste many other fish and chips during my trip, I honestly think this place has it down to a crisp. Get it? Anyway, the fish was delightfully tender on the inside as if I were eating an actual fish rather than some processed cod mash you find in the freezer section. The fried batter merely enhanced the texture of the cod rather than overwhelm the taste. The tartar sauce was also refreshing rather than overpowering. Also, there was just the right amount of chips and peas on the plate. Great grub indeed.Next time I come back to London, I'll definitely be thinking about a plate of fish and chips from this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips!

-3Yb2zcbRLGbAtBa-5_K5g.text: Mmmmmm... if you can fit into this cozy little pub, you should! It is a great place to hang out, have a beer (or two) and enjoy yourself. The fish and chips were delicious, and the smell was so powerful from outside I simply could not walk by without coming in. Enjoy!

JISRQAW3tTvkPw_RxdWV9g.text: My wife Nancy and I stopped by today and had a wonderful time. Friendly staff and great food. And of course, Guinness. A real treat after several hours of wandering the streets of London and the Churchill War Rooms. Allan.

6yxUNM0ZF9K7zIzUKZFCbg.text: Horrible. But we were hungry and desperate after a long day of sightseeing.  I ordered the fish and chips, which is a pretty simple dish to exexute, right? The dish came out soggy, the gravy was bland, and the peas tasted like they were in the freezer for too long. Ok, this is a pub. But I expected the food to be at least decent. Nope, not even a good Guiness can wash this down. Drinks are fine, but go elsewhere for food.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Exterior

vZ7qFY7GyQM7Poh9-WphdQ.text: If you are looking for a quick meal, after a day of sightseeing like we were, St. Steven's is a pub with some decent food. Since St. Stephen's was located in the heart of Parliament Square, it was expected that there would be plenty of other tourists, but to our surprise there were plenty of locals in there.Even though the pub was pretty crowded, we received a table right away when we walked in around 5pm. We were probably the last lucky ones before a real wait began to build up. We took a seat in their bar area, which was pretty tight-fitting. The tables were one on top of the other. We received a menu from a waitress and proceeded to order asap at the bar. (Keep in mind, as with all pubs in London, order your food at the bar.)We ordered the hand battered Fish & Chips and Sausage & Mash.Fish & Chips (Hand Battered) -  The order consisted of a Tomato Ketchup Tanglefoot Ale Battered Cod, Tartare Sauce, Chips and Garden Peas. Since this was my 1st fish and chips in London, I thought it was pretty good. The cod was fried well, but quickly softened as I doused it with vinegar. I felt that the plate could have contained a bit more chips. As for the peas, there wasn't much transformation with it. It possibly could have been frozen peas that were just microwaved.Sausage & Mash The order consisted of 3 good size sausages sitting in a Stowford Press Cider & Red Onion Gravy. There was a small side of mash and the same peas from the Fish & Chips. The sausage was good, but nothing that knocked our socks off. Also, the mash was of a good soft texture and went well with the gravy.Crispy Battered Squid Rings, Sweet Chilli Sauce Pork & Herb Sausages, Stowford Press Cider & Red Onion Gravy & GardenBeing that this was our very 1st meal in London, we didn't have much to compare it against the day we went. The pub was lively, the food was good, but nothing about the food really blew us away. It satisfied us, but I couldn't say that the food here at this pub was something I had never tried before. It was a good average conveniently located  pub and worth coming to if you're in need of a pint or meal in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Menu Cover
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Condiments!

5Vax0LSLo45RxYKyRKeeTA.text: This is our first trip to London, hubby and daughter wanted fish and chips. I am not a big fan of fish but decided to go anyway. Both hubby and daughter devoured their plates of food. I ordered bangers and mash, AMAZING. Potatoes were creamy, gravy had a great flavor and no lumps, sausage was outstanding.  We only have 2 more days in London and might be back if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Bangers and Mash, no peas.

5gnC_IYb2jUwedSsCpbkxQ.text: Food was awesome you must order the Fish and Chips.  I would of given them a 5 star but waitress didnt get my beer.  She didnt charge me but I did order it.

zpR5yi9pZe-sc7TWWAhGmw.text: St. Stephen's Tavern is conveniently located to Big Ben and Victoria station so it can get quite busy. The Fish & Chips are very, very good and so are the peas the come with it. I highly recommend this place for their food, but actually their service is not too good. I ordered one beer with my dinner and wanted a second one but the waitress was too busy to notice me waving at her. It also took a long time to get our bill.Overall, food and beer was great, the service average.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish & Chips and peas, which were very fresh, sweet and crisp,not over steamed.
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Soooo good, ate everything
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Condiments

xitKLADCiXN_YQmZIBcLGg.text: Pretty busy after 8, but you'll find a table. I had the fish & chips, along with a pint. I enjoyed every bite. Make sure to order at the bar, because the servers don't take your order.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

bD99XNj19YvgZtJEaISNdQ.text: This place has a great location. The seating is a little cramped but there are a few tables as well as standing room for a quick pint. You are assigned a seat number and order at the bar. The food comes out quick and they do a nice job trying to turn over costumers.  I think they add a side of cooked pees to everything, maybe it's a signature side. The hand pies were really great and very filling. If I had those alone, I think my rating might be higher. The burger was not so much however. It was dry and the bun was almost like a thick pita bread.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Hand pies. Really good
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Burger
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Burger

6nGRjZRz4IjJHpPDDDIaOA.text: I would leave zero stars if it were an option. Don't waste your time going here. Just admire the tavern from the outside. Everyone that works in this establishment is miserable and takes it out on the customers. Seriously, the people that own or manage this place must be horrible people. They are not helpful in anyway and treat everyone like an inconvenience and the beer selection is not what anyone would expect from a tavern in such a busy location, not good at all. Much better options all around the area.

rFHKypxIrHu81q4VqO7m-A.text: Both tourist trap and local hangout, I think this place is always packed. It certainly has that old fashioned tavern feel, though, with barely any elbow room to spare. The tables are situated nicely, however, and it's cozy enough to enjoy a meal without feeling like a sardine.The food is your typical bar/ pub fare, with fish & chips, burgers of several different varieties, and small plates, with plenty of booze to go around. They also have a designated area outside the tavern where you can stand with your beer and have a chat with your mates, if you're into that sorrow thing. I ordered the Sweet Chili Chicken Burger with chicken goujons, mayo, lettuce, tomato, redo onion, chips, and sweet chili sauce. It wasn't anything to stand up and scream about, but it was good; though a bit pricey for what you get. The winning point of this restaurant is its proximity to all the local tourist attractions: the London Eye, Big Ben, literally across the street, Buckingham Palace about a 15 minute walk down the way, and the River Thame. Not a bad place to refuel for the rest of your journey, eh?

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Sweet Chili Chicken Burger
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

ZAIm8sm9-h9WA5gEY1Uudg.text: Late lunch on a Sunday. Split the fish and chips- really decent sized portions. Prices reasonable. Service was ok. Upstairs was warm and close seating made it seem warmer. Good stop for a mid day lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips- large enough to split
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Small plates - single serving or can share as an appetizer
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Bigger plates- can be split

h5xQ1gyckGcpWKUIP89Gkw.text: Delicious pub food and great service. Variety of ales available as well as different food choices. I really enjoyed the delicious sweet tomato relish that came with my ham & cheese croquettes starter.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

66H5ET1jqkvyytYkOT91Vg.text: This is an old tradition tavern and as such is old style everything.  We order some drinks and a little old european kind of serving.   Nothing cold. Even the beer was room temperature.  The beer was good even at room temperature. Lol.  Also we ordered the fish and chips old traditional style but the highlight was the curry sauce.   My daughter who was with me said is just like japanese plain curry.   I loved the taste.  The bill was a little high 100 british pounds for all five of us uncluding tip.   But oh well now i can say i went to this place which sits across the parlament, the Big Ben clock and the Westminister Abbey

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

5VFCdOSd1r7Ng5RNtAy9pA.text: Frustrated with the food in London my friend and I wandered in and ordered the burger and pesto chicken pasta. I was so happy with the pasta I had to yelp. The food and coffee in London is horrific and on the last day of our stay I'm glad to have found this spot.

xAXN50g4pvL7F95IFGwB0g.text: I stumbled upon this place after sightseeing at Westminister Abbey, London eye & Big Ben. It was here that I first experienced UK style fish & chips. I didn't expect much given its proximity to major tourist attractions. In my experience, restaurants near tourist attractions are generally not very good. However, I was pleasantly surprised; the  fish & chips were actually very good. The fish was crisp which paired well with the accompanying tarter sauce. I enjoyed the crisp chips as well.Ordered a Rekorderlig Premium Strawberry-Lime Cider. It was to die for. Wish I could've shipped a crate of it back to the states, Word to the wise. This is a sweet cider, for those of us who want to like beer, but don't really care for the taste.Service was nothing to write home about, but it was efficient. The one thing that did annoy me was my servers comment "I should've known" after I placedd my fish and chips order; I suppose this was due to the prevailing abundance of American tourists there all wanting to experience UK style fish & chips. This actually gave me a sense of If you're in the area, pop in for fish in chips. It's a great place to break away from all the surrounding hustle & bustle.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Yes yes yes!
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry & Lime Cider
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

jfUrmETlv7dVpmo12F6cHg.text: Our hotel receptionist recommended this spot to us for their fish and chips while visiting London. The restaurant was packed when when we arrived and this was a good sign that it's legit. Wow, their fish and chips and beef pot pie was phenomenal!! Best I've had by far! Also, the view of Big Ben wasn't bad either. :)

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Beef pot pie was flaky, crispy, & scrumptious!
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. The famous fish and chips.

qC0B5mmM2BK9kUOOktaYZg.text: When my wife and I decided to visit London for the first time, eating fish and chips at a local pub was one of the top items on my list. After countless Yelp reviews, I finally landed on St. Stephen's Tavern. Was it the most authentic fish & chips in London? Probably not. Just like eating at a Times Square Italian restaurant isn't the most authentic New York City cuisine, but given the reviews, the location compared to our list of attractions, and even the decor, I knew it was the perfect place to go.Knowing that the dinner rush would probably be maddening for such a small pub in a crowded part of the city, we actually decided to show up rather early at around 17:00 (that's 5:00pm for us Americans). We waited about 2 minutes (just enough time to peak at the traditional decor at the bar) and then were brought upstairs to a small table. We found it rather stuffy up there, but London isn't exactly known for its air conditioning (and why would it need it most of the year? We just happened to visit during some oddly hot 90-degree weather).Even though I already knew exactly what I wanted, I took a quick look at the menu. To be honest I really wanted to sample one of the local ales, but sadly I was actually sick during our trip, so I was staying away from alcohol (wah!). The selection did look terrific though. The waiter came around and I ordered the traditional fish and chips with peas. My wife was not in the mood for seafood and decided on the Caesar salad burger.About 20 minutes after we ordered, our food arrived. Holy cow was that fish massive! Still, I almost ate the entire thing it was so good! Crispy, juicy, and savory. I also really loved the chips and the peas were a terrific compliment to the dish. My wife also reported that she enjoyed the burger (I had a bite and enjoyed it as well).My one gripe? The service was just "ok". To be honest, we didn't have a great service experience anywhere in London, so this wasn't that big of a disappointment, but some added customer service would have been nice.So what's the verdict? If you're near Westminster and wanting some traditional fish & chips (in a touristy area but a not-so-touristy pub), this place definitely fits the bill. Just be warned there was a line out the door when we walked out (during the early dinner rush).

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips with peas
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Caesar salad burger
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Traditional British bar

GO2vIeWcnkwuA7Z0J_YWTg.text: Very nice British decor and we sat upstairs in a booth that was very cozy. Came around 6:30pm, downstairs is the pub that was very busy while upstairs the restaurant which only allow a seating of maybe 20 ppl were empty. We were the one party to sit down but by 7:30pm all the tables were taken.We ordered fish n chips, sausage and mash and the half pound burger.The fish n chips reminded me of a McDonald filet o fish in terms of taste, even McDonald fries were better as well. The sausage tasted like something u can buy from a frozen dinner and the burger is similar to one u would encounter from a school cafeteria that's well down and dry.The service was fine so hence the 3 star. Probably more a 2 and a half.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish n chips, taste like McDonald filet o fish
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Sausage and mash. Sausage taste like something from a frozen dinner
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Half pound burger. Taste like something from a very bad school cafeteria

EOLiLWzyZvCUbN0L65nrDw.text: Stopped here during our one day trip to London, solely based on reviews. We ordered some beer at the bar while we waited, which was shorter time than expected despite the place being quite busy. Once seated, we had to walk to bar again to order our food and drinks (they don't take the order at the table). Thought this was kind of strange but no big deal. Good food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Similar to a Shepherd's Pie
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Chilli Cheese Chips

TOhJKvXyNtRSWV6XOi0R6Q.text: Totally not a fan of fish, ever. But I figured while in London I must try the famous fish and chips! It was lightly battered and fried. Reminded me as if I was just eating chicken strips so that helped me not think of the fact I was eating a fish lol. I had it with tartar sauce, and as tempted as I was to have ketchup on my 'chips' I opted to eat them with vinegar like a local. It was quite tasteful. I would definitely order it again, and recommend to expand your palette when traveling abroad!

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish & Chips!

rhuSdXCLcY2QWj-meTUz0w.text: Fish & Chips weren't as good as the Green Chicken Curry.  Small selection of beers, friendly staff and nice place - every thing you would want in a public house and more!

CcVGKfmz4hU7Bw13mi6Euw.text: Fast food and service and good fish and chips. Peas were part of this this so I suppose the vegetable depends on the location. Last place had cabbage and green beans.  I thought the food was rather plain but on a busy day was fast. 4 stars for service more than anything else. The ale was good too.

OtG6mlKs3JVt73LVfGRsqQ.text: First meal in London and it definitely set a high standard. The fish was perfect and I tried vinegar for the first time on my fries. This place didn't have much seating but it was worth the struggle.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

0RHPI6-fZBEu7H2-leP_wQ.text: Very busy tavern as it is close to all the top attractions in London. Tables are small so I don't really recommend it if you have a large group. We ordered the fish and chips, the scampi and chips and potato skins. The fish and chips outshined all other items we ordered. It is a little overpriced £14, but based on location it's what I expected. At least the portion size was generous.  It's a little weird that they seat you but you have to go order from the bar. The food was prompt and hot as you know it didn't linger under a heat lamp before it came to your table. For me the most interesting was seeing the food delivered to the severs via a dumb waiter as I watched them pull hot plates out of a little cabinet near the bar. If you want tavern style experience in London this the place I enjoyed. Service needs improvement as the workers didn't seem happy but overall it was Good experience for a last minute decision.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Potato skins. Better than the US version. But nothing to crave about.
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Busy interior around lunch time
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

h_VFfHiK6YlwJwjaA2eWwQ.text: While it seems this place is in a perfect tourist trap area we found the service to be quite good, the prices to be fair and the food to be great. There were plenty of businessmen having a beer when we ate lunch!It's quite a convenient location and the fish and chips were good. My mom and I shared the fish and chips platte that included prawns, it was enough for us. We ordered a side of sweet potato fries which were great!!It's cozy and cute and great for lunch!!

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chip shop platter
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Sweet potato fries
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Front bar

RB3-aeeFAYR_x8FN455fYQ.text: I love this bar and the memories I've made in this spot!The vibe is very happening and fun. though in a great location I wouldn't call it touristy!I would recommend it to all my friends visiting London!

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. 2013

zG8uNT0HJeBC395N_ctb-Q.text: Despite being in a heavily tourist area, this spot had a welcoming smell of fish and chips for a snowy Friday evening. Not too bad of a wait for a table of two (10 minutes), as we looked through the menu.Although we got seated by a waitress, they told us to go order everything at the bar. Thankfully there was no one ahead of us, so ordered the Fish and Chips (£14) and a pint of beer (£5?). Beer came fairly fast, had a decent ale with moderate hop (noticed lots of beers in the area are middle-ground ABV). After 20 minutes our food order came out, however they gave my friend a salad instead of the burger he asked for. This took an additional 5 minutes for them to correct. As to the food itself, fish is breaded well without being overdone. Paired with the tarter sauce made for a delicious bite. Chips were thick cut and went well with some vinegar and mayo. Peas were an afterthought.Aside from a couple hiccups, service was fine. If you don't want to walk around then this is a fine enough option for a sit-down meal.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Some beers on draft

KVfDwA-Wc1gfc0qrwtZhmQ.text: Cute little touristy spot. Perfect location by the London Eye and Big Ben. In this area everyone is trying to shove "fish n chips" down your throat but I'm glad we came here. Has a pub feel to it, and you're table is super close to other people's due to lack of space but it kind of added so charm to the place lol. We had fish n chips and a beer which were good, exactly what you'd expect from a tourist area. Service was good and we were seated immediately. Ordered the fries but it hardly had any meat, but they were still good probably wouldn't order them again. Other than that, nice place stop by if you're in the mood for some fish n chips lol.

sN2jtkzRiU4zs6VorvcPfg.text: I'm pleased to learn that my review will be the centennial review of St. Stephen's Tavern, so why not 5 stars, that's a 100 in my book!Quaint place in a heavily congested area across from Westminster Abbey. Walking in gives you the feeling that you can forget the real world problems and enjoy a pint until you walk out and recall the bustle of the city. A tip of the cap to the ownership for maintaining the nostalgia of the pub, and for those who have yet to experience, you'll enjoy it as I did for years to come. Friendly patrons, welcoming staff, reasonable prices and jolly atmosphere all make for a good time. Big Fan!

bZ5KdJry8jotv_qUsyOSnw.text: Old time pub/restaurant. I thoroughly enjoyed it for this reason alone. It's a tight squeeze overall. Tables mashed together in a small dining area with stool seating. Elbow to elbow with all that are drinking or eating. This is what makes it a true British pub experience right? Of course I went for the fish and chips with a pear cider. Can't get enough of either one.  Friendly service and staff. Truly enjoyed this place.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

LU-viCxTCqMoVESu3YEXoQ.text: Conveniently located across from the Big Ben, this is a tavern with dining served upstairs. However, if u manage to get a table downstairs at the bar, go for it. Food is typical pub fare: fish and chips, burgers, mash. Food is a little bland but hey, u don't come for the food. You come to people watch and recharge as you continue sight seeing.Good place to people watch as it gets filled with tourists.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

HM7jxDifTJnehPRE7ftE3Q.text: Excellent fish and chips .Generous portion.Place is all you imagine with cozy seats .Very close to London bridge

hT8acT5L7VFqraLg0KGYwQ.text: Mediocre- service, food, all of it. Place looks tired, staff like they'd rather not have your business.

N3BTJs1WnOUVvjpxCTf2qQ.text: Super pricey fish and chips! $87 in pounds for 3 fish and chip plates and 3 pints of beer...Ouch. I guess we should have known better since this spot sits in a prime tourist location and it was packed with mostly American tourists.  Lol.  Even though it was super busy, we only waited around 10 min for a table.  When in London eat as the Brits so we all ordered fish and chips. A nice large sized piece of battered crispy fish (flaky and mild like a cod), a heaping mound of hot crispy chips (fries) all with a side of green peas.  The only thing that was lacking in our food was salt but we noticed across the board that English food is not as salty as what we're used to in the US.  Those fries would have been banging if had they've been a little salty. The service was ok, we waited a while before catching our server's attention to order. We also had to ask twice for water.

gt1jbj_U4Sz-Lqe48A9xRA.text: Their fish and chips is one of my favorites in the area. They also have a fantastic atmoshpere and I love their upstairs. There's a dumb-waiter which makes service particularly smooth for the second floor. We had a fantastic waitress and we all enjoyed our meal. I did get a kick out of all the options for packaged sauces for my fries (chips) and fish.

s-T9bGzlCn7JdJkKTto2tQ.text: Food was incredible, and could not ask for a better dinner. Our first time in the UK, my boyfriend and I found St. Stephen's Tavern using Yelp. The place was clean and beautiful, staff was nice and helpful, and the food was sublime. The perfect London experience :)

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

ACDYcrLeaKcFIlr2EW8LRw.text: Fantastic food! Fantastic spinach and squash lasagna! Best meal since I've been in Europe. Little bit of a wait, but the Guiness helped! Loved our waitress, too!

Nn1nLoMU0Q_nRm3ilvddZg.text: We found this place searching for dinner and ended up walking in for brunch.  The ham and eggs were remarkable, when most ham is mundane.  Seating comfort is a challenge but ok for a time.

qI32XgTY-nHf51_iHEEfGA.text: Very tasty meal.  Good staff.  Interesting mix of patrons. A solid 4, but well short of a five.  Too crowded. Table seating was uncomfortably tight. Beyond satisfactory. I'd return for the food, but not the awkwardly tight atmosphere.

3DDXX7coDBZAPyRmVfeZ0g.text: This was our very first place to eat in London.  Having just arrived at our hotel in the Earls ACourts area, we hopped abopard the Tube and headed for Westminster.  After a short walk around it was late and we decided to check this place out.  My first ever real English Fish n Chips and the wife had a meat pie.  The food was really good and the beer plentiful.

XVg4uUgkjbBe6JzQLyb-cQ.text: Great British tavern food.  Curry is yummy.  Upstairs seating is great.  Bangers and mash and steak pie are really good too.

nN1m7-QdiDj1bJXhJXm9bA.text: After myself and my friend ordered our food, a lady approached us and told us that we hadn't ordered enough food and asked us to leave if we weren't going to order more as they were very busy.  This was certainly a new experience for me; absolutely ridiculous.  Aside from the above, the pub was extremely cramped with less than 20cm between neighboring tables.

SSzEI_CFQ1xw2ntfZWgGwA.text: Reading existing reviews, not much has changed in the past years. The exterior is appealing which stopped me from entering the first time, being afraid of horrendous prices, but I finally went there with my parents in September. The inside has got a great atmosphere, especially upstairs where you can observe the unique ceiling and overlook the ground floor; however it gets easily crammed when many tables are occupied.The menu goes a bit beyond the usual pub grub such that there are some lighter alternatives to choose from together with a few starters and sides. Real ale is on offer alongside Hofbräu from Munich. The food is good and not that expensive given it is located in an area extremely popular with tourists with the Houses of Parliaments and the Clock Tower are just across the road and the London Eye just across Westminster Bridge.It is worth to pop in just for a pint.

photos.caption: Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom
Photo of St Stephen's Tavern - London, United Kingdom

SJhCLmZZqG8eKCnXMff93w.text: Walked by this place on our way back from a walk Along the Thames. It's right next to the Westminster underground, across from BigBen. We went upstairs for dining and were surprised by how small it was. We're seated at a small table (all are small, but tables for 2 are tiny) with stools. Food came pretty quickly and was pretty good. A little pricy for what you get but I think that's mainly because of the location. If you are in the area and need a place to eat, ok, but I wouldn't go out of the way for this place. More like 3.5 stars.

xe2zVgDGeIN-jk2uR1DIXw.text: It was lunchtime on our vacation and we weren't really hungry but knew we needed to have something to eat, so we stopped in here.  Great location, we gazed at Big Ben right across the street while we ate.  We both ordered unfamiliar  beer and were happy with our choices, and we split a burger (which came with fries and a small salad) and then had an order of the cheese fries.  I wish I could have brought the cheese home that was on the fries - delicious, and the fries were crisp and fresh.  The burger was very tasty, with tomato chutney that added a nice touch.  We didn't think it was too expensive, considering it was London, and the location.  Tho it was very crowded, we got lucky and were seated immediately.  The tables are very tiny, and my husband sat on the back bench next to me and fell into a sink hole in the seat, so he wound up sitting in a miniature stool.  No problems - it was an authentic pub atmosphere and we really enjoyed ourselves.  We would definitely recommend it to Londoners and tourists alike!

3RhukPk5aU0rNrYq38ky1w.text: I visited today and loved it, location fantastic and really nice feel to the place.

9qcqiOTfm6qKWiVvHX8u3g.text: Greeted by the impressive exterior with the big old lamps you are lead into a warm and cosy interior. This lovely traditional pub has a great and specific atmosphere which is impossible to explain.A good choice of drinks (including real ales) and a promising menu for their food are waiting.The barmaid was very friendly and tried to tempt us to eat something (in a nice way).(The special situation connected with the parliament opposite was already mentioned by earlier reviewers.)

sAFGoXxz2ao0Cd3PMFZ1Wg.text: A proper pub a stones throw from Parliament (they ring bells when votes are called in the Houses and exciting to see who gets up and leaves when they do!) Surprisingly usually somewhere to sit, especially upstairs. Packed full of officials and Parliamentarians and they serve reasonably priced white wine in a cooler bucket. Good.

2xwJbLes8iszQOluVwxcIA.text: Had a really nice Chicken Jalfrezi here, served with naan bread and mango chutney, mmmm! Watch out, it's a bit on the hot side! Service was fast and efficient in a pleasant atmosphere. Recommended.

5MLsaTNYRj0GJ3jLg_GIjg.text: Great old pub with nice atmosphere, well run, good selection of drinks and menu - but arrive early as kitchen often shuts about 9pm when the regular crowd of officials dries up! Busy at lunchtimes and 5-7pm due to its location, but a fairly quick turnover of the regular crowd means you can get a seat before long. Always worth checking upstairs. And it's quiet at the weekend and late evening! Not the cheapest of venues but average for London pub prices - and it has to be the closest for tourists needing a break from the sights of Parliament.
